summary: the development of antiviral agents targeting virus-encoded enzymes has achieved great success in the last few decades. however, the antiviral activity of these direct-acting antiviral agents is usually virus specific, and treatment failure occurs due to the emergence of drug-resistant viruses. targeting host functions essential for viral replication should have a much higher genetic barrier for drug resistance and may inhibit all the viruses that depend on the targeted host function. iminosugars disrupt the glycan processing of viral envelope proteins. antiviral activities of several iminosugar compounds against dengue virus (DENV) (14–19), japan encephalitis virus (JEV) (20), EBOV (20) and marburg virus (21) have been demonstrated in mice. iminosugar treatment altered the glycan structure of angiotensin I-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), the cellular receptor of SARS-CoV and HCoV-NL63 (24, 25). ACE2 does not affect its cell surface expression or binding to SARS-CoV spike glycoprotein, but impairs the viral envelope spike glycoprotein-triggered membrane fusion. clonal antibody against the myc epitope was obtained from Pierce. ACE2 protein was purified by protein A/G beads conjugated with polyclonal anti-ACE2 antibody. the peak labeled A2G2 is a core fucosylated biantennary glycan with terminal galactose residues. iminosugar treatment does not alter ACE2 cell surface expression and binding to SARS-CoV spike protein. a flow cytometry analysis of intact FLP-IN/ACE2 cells showed that the iminosugar treatment did not affect the amount of ACE2 protein expressed on the plasma membrane. the results showed that IHVR-17028 treatment did not inhibit the fusion protein from binding ACE2-expressing cells. the results showed that iminosugar suppression of SARS-CoV spike protein-mediated infectious entry is most likely not due to the inhibition of ACE2 expression on the cell surface or impairment of its ability to bind the virus. 293T cells transfected with plasmids encoding either SARS-CoV S protein or ACE2 were mock treated or treated with 50 M IHVR-17028 for 48 h. for syncytium formation, the cells were mixed at a 1:1 ratio and cultured for 24 h. the transfected cells were mock treated or treated with IHVR-17028 for 48 h. the cells were then mixed at a 1:1 ratio and cultured for 24 h. the extent of cell fusion between the ACE2- and spike protein-expressing cells can be quantified by measuring luciferase activity. ER glucosidase inhibitors prevent the removal of terminal glucose moieties on N-linked glycans. inhibition of ER glucosidase I and/or II prevents the removal of the terminal glucose moieties on N-linked glycans. infectivity of viral particles secreted from iminosugar-treated cells is generally reduced (51–53) for most enveloped viruses investigated, reductions in virion secretion and infectivity are responsible for the overall antiviral effects of iminosugars. the paramount concern is the toxicity underlying the “on-target” suppression of host functions required for viral replication. iminosugar-treated cells can be processed through an alternative pathway that trims the N-linked glycans by cleaving the oligosaccharide chains between the internal mannose moieties by Golgi endomannosidases (39–41). the resulting N-linked glycans are further processed and matured into complex glycans in the Golgi apparatus. a possible scenario is that alteration of ACE2 N-linked glycans compromises its dynamic interaction with viral envelope glycoproteins during membrane fusion. alteration of N-linked glycans may disrupt ACE2 interaction with another cellular component(s) that facilitates the membrane fusion between virus and host cells. this differential effect of IHVR-17028 on SARS-CoV and CoV-NL63 glycoprotein-mediated infectious entry is most likely because one or multiple post- ER glucosidase inhibitors are the ideal antiviral agents for treatment of acute viral infections, particularly viral hemorrhagic fevers and severe respiratory tract viral infections. both viral hemorrhagic fevers and severe respiratory tract viral infections are sometimes life-threatening and have a short time window.
